@DavisGod That's the thing: the pages here at nhentai are much smaller than the ones at hitomi.la. I know that the comments section here is long but MrYoso29 about a month ago cleaned the pages he presumably got from here, not hitomi.la. The ones at hitomi.la are twice as large in both length and width. And I have been using those pages for when I both clean and translate. I actually had to downscale my pages in order to meet the image host's size requirement. That's one of the reasons I'll be continuing my translation. But I'm surprised it hasn't been posted here, yet.

Okay, so I read through the whole thing (I didn't want to at first because I didn't want it to influence my translation.) But looking at it, I noticed that many of his translations are similar to ones I've done, and well... some aren't. While I may disagree with some word choices, I still think that as far as an attempt to translate this 120 page volume, it's pretty good. Once again, great job, @cc0dykid.

@hotrod1112: It's alright. I already know what most of it is about. After taking a glimpse of several pages of his translation, I'm going to continue on with my translation. It would've been better to use the pages from hitomi.la instead of the ones here, which are much smaller (and therefore less defined.) But thanks @cc0dykid for your work. I imagined it must've been a labor of love cleaning and translating those pages.

@hotrod1112: some Kanji make sense, while others don't to me. Also I'm using more than just Google Translate, I'm also using a Japanese sound effects index, a Japanese dictionary, a Japanese grammar index, and reddit. I also know many Japanese phrases from years of watching hentai and anime so the romaji at times offer a clear translation. With that said, should there be any reason that cc0dykid not release a translation, I'll continue to translate pages until it's eventually done. So, here' another page - page 82 (page 83, here): https://i.imgur.com/p8Z9dMG.jpg

@hotrod1112: It's not that I don't want to, but it takes longer than you think. Doing a single page is often a hassle because I both clean the image and add the translations. Not to mention, I have to make some sense out of the translations. If there are more people working on certain aspects of the manga, particularly the translations (or even documenting the kanji used) we could get it translated sooner (or at least until a more seasoned translator finish working on it.) With that said, here's another page, page 102 (103 here): http://ist4-1.filesor.com/pimpandhost.com/1/_/_/_/1/5/u/1/l/5u1lc/102_v2.jpg   The next three pages of that scene are coming since I've already translated them.

@8TB: oh, i get it, thank you for the info.

@hotrod112, silentherow, DavisGod, dest9: This series is a doujinshi which is just another word for amateur work. Now that he's releasing a comic version, it's official. If it were a video, the "comic version" would be a DVD-Box. @Lich: yeah, I know. The sentence reads, "Shita be Ro be ro suru chū shiyou yo shirabeta nda yo ne." Shita introduces the imperative; be ro be ro is the "licking, licking"; chu suru is "to kiss"; shiyou is "let's"; yo shirabeta is the indicative of to "check, examine, or research; and nda yo ne is the expectation of agreement. (I researched it before I translated it) It's literal translation would be, "(of course) let's kiss with the licking-licking to check (right?)" That doesn't read natural among English speakers so I settled for "We should kiss to find out." The "should" resolves the expectation of agreement that you'd find in "of course" or "right?"
@8TB For the final page, the fifth and sixth bubble in the last panel in korean say: "the kiss with tongue...and licking-licking.""for research, of course."

Google Translate really does suck. I attempted to translate what Ko-chan says on the top panel of page 24 (pg. 25 here.) Now when I entered the Kanji, it stated, "Oh... Ku... Oh! Oh My grandfather's sooo good feeling." Like me, you'd think this makes no sense. But under the Kanji, Google also shows the Romaji, which reads "A~tsu... Ku~tsu... A~tsu! O, Oba-san, sore suggoi kimochii" Now my Japanese isn't great, but I've watched enough anime and hentai to know that sentence means "Oh... Ku... Oh! Aunt [Auntie] that feels so good," or "that feels amazing." I don't know why there's such a disparity in translating the Kanji and what the Romaji denotes. Just a helpful tip for those using Google Translate.

@Gridlock: I virtually got the same results when I used Google translate to attempt a translation of the first page. Remember that some of the lines are just one word, so many times, translating the speech bubble as though it were one sentence helps. What I got from translating the first page was: "Ko-chan came on the 6th night. Auntie, are you awake? You're awake aren't you? Are you still angry about what happened yesterday?" Sometimes you get a better result when using commas. It's difficult because to non-natives, the nuances of Japanese can get lost. So it as you say: when google translates some of it, it does appear to be gibberish.

2 6日目の夜|甥っ子が来てから: Night on day 6 | Since my nephew came

@hotrod1112: haha. Too many panels; too many pages. I've taken to translate only the pages with transitions or setups, so I can tell what's going on. If the pages have little dialogue, I might translate those as well. Google translate has a function known as "handwrite" where you can draw the Kanji. It's not that Google Translate doesn't recognize some characters, it's more that Kuroneko's handwriting in some cases is deemed illegible by GT because Kuroneko's handwriting is stylistic rather than standard. But I figured some of the Kanji out.

@Clancy: No. It's not translated on the DLSite. The mangaka is Japanese. He produces his work in Japanese. The only way it gets translated outside of online amateur translations is if an English (UK or US) production company distributes it. Thus far, that hasn't happened. (And likely, it won't happen because the story is about an aunt who has an incestuous sexual relationship with her pubescent nephew.) A doujinshi of this length will not be translated in a week, or two. Best case scenario: three weeks. But it could take longer, so prepare yourself for that.

As for the translation, trust me, I want it translated soon, too. I attempt only to help everyone temper their expectations. This doujinshi appears to be quite popular so I'm sure it'll be translated soon. But soon, realistically, could mean three weeks. And that's one of the best case scenarios. Kuroneko's other work "Kaa-san no Ana Tsukawasete" took almost a year to have the first volume translated and three months for the second volume.

@hotrod1112: I liked Taboo Charming Mother, but often the art was inconsistent. Yoshiten was responsible for Bible Black's art and animation, and he's the first I thought of. But he doesn't work on anything anymore. Jumondo was responsible for "Boku to Misaki Sensei" and "Victorian Maid Maria no Houshi." Those were probably the best hentai animations of the last two years. If Tatefuji does it, I would imagine it would look something like this: http://ist4-1.filesor.com/pimpandhost.com/1/_/_/_/1/5/m/w/O/5mwOk/Kyouko_l.jpg

By the way, I've wanted to ask this thread: if this were being animated, which company/artist would you like to handle it? My thoughts immediately go to Yoshiten. But he's a hermit, now. Queen Bee may be nice since the concept art is usually on par with the manga's, but their animation... well it sucks. My first choice would be production company, Jumondo. Then it would be artist Tatefuji Kenichi (Night Shift Nurses, Panchira Sensei, Kichiku: Oyako Choukyo Nikki.) Third it would be animation company, Mary Jane.

I have some mixed feelings about this. I had to browse through it a second time. Parts of it are really good, but the parts where I would levy criticism are where it's noticeable that there's a drop in quality. The first part had a handful of these indiscretions that could easily be overlooked but in the second part, some of them are blatantly obvious. Don't get me wrong, all in all, I liked it, but I think some parts would've been better if there wasn't a lack of effort in drawing some panels. Definitely would like to see it translated, though.
